headline: SOLSTICE ADVANCED MATERIALS BREAKS GROUND ON $200 MILLION SPOKANE EXPANSION TO DRIVE SEMICONDUCTOR INNOVATION
summary: Solstice Advanced Materials (NASDAQ: SOLS), a leading pure-play specialty materials company, today announced it has broken ground on a $200 million investment to expand and modernize its electronic materials facility in Spokane Valley, Washington. By the end of 2029, the facility's current production capacity for sputtering targets is expected to double, helping meet growing customer demand amid rapid expansion across the industry.

content.title: SOLSTICE ADVANCED MATERIALS BREAKS GROUND ON $200 MILLION SPOKANE EXPANSION TO DRIVE SEMICONDUCTOR INNOVATION
content.summary: Solstice Advanced Materials (NASDAQ: SOLS), a leading pure-play specialty materials company, today announced it has broken ground on a $200 million investment to expand and modernize its electronic materials facility in Spokane Valley, Washington. By the end of 2029, the facility's current production capacity for sputtering targets is expected to double, helping meet growing customer demand amid rapid expansion across the industry.

thumbnail.caption: Southside view of Solstice Advanced Materials Spokane Facility, highlighting 110K sq. ft expansion groundbreaking site.
